get_survey_responses exports a survey into R Export survey responses into R and/or save exported file. Currently single exports calls are limited to 1.8 GB. Above that size, we recommend you split your export accross different date ranges

get_survey_responses.Rd

get_survey_responses exports a survey into R Export survey responses into R and/or save exported file. Currently single exports calls are limited to 1.8 GB. Above that size, we recommend you split your export accross different date ranges

get_survey_responses(surveyId, format = "json", saveDir = NULL,
  filename = NULL, verbose = FALSE, startDate = NULL,
  endDate = NULL, limit = NULL, useLabels = "true",
  seenUnansweredRecode = "false",
  multiSelectSeenUnansweredRecode = "false",
  includeDisplayOrder = "false", formatDecimalAsComma = "false",
  timeZone = NULL, newlineReplacement = "\n", questionIds = NULL,
  embeddedDataIds = NULL, surveyMetadataIds = NULL,
  compress = "true")

Arguments

surveyId

the id of survey to copy
format

file format json, by default (can be csv or tsv). We don't provide SPSS yet.
saveDir

path to a local directory to save the exported file. Default is a temporary file in rds format that is removed as the end of your session. Default name will be the surveyId.
filename

specify filename for saving. If NULL, uses the survey id
verbose

prints progress bars for download (set to false by default)
startDate

only export responses recorded after the specified date (2016-04-01T07:31:43Z) (see https://api.qualtrics.com/docs/dates-and-times)
endDate

only export responses before the specified date
limit

maximum number of respones exported
useLabels

instead of exporting the recode value for the answer choice, export the text of the answer choice (https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/survey-module/question-options/recode-values/)
seenUnansweredRecode

recode seen but unanswered questions with this value.
multiSelectSeenUnansweredRecode

recode seen but unanswered choices for multi-select questions. Default is seenUnansweredRecode value.
includeDisplayOrder

include display order information in your export. Useful for surveys with randomization (true or false)
formatDecimalAsComma

use a comma as a decimal separator instead of a period (true or false)
timeZone

timezone used to determine response date values (default is UTC/GMT). See https://api.qualtrics.com/docs/time-zones.
newlineReplacement

configure the newline delimiter for the export (default is '\n'.)
questionIds

JSON array of Question IDs e.g. (["QID1", "QID3", ... , "QID5"])
embeddedDataIds

export only specified embeddeddata (array of strings)
surveyMetadataIds

export only specified survey metadata columns (array of strings)
compress

compressed by default (set to FALSE if uncompressed file desired)

Value

A status code

See also

https://api.qualtrics.com/docs/getting-survey-responses-new for more documentation

Examples

# NOT RUN {
get_survey_responses("SV_012345678901234","csv")
# }# NOT RUN {
mysurvey <- getSurvey(surveyID = "SV_012345678901234",
                      startDate = "2017-01-01",
                      endDate = "2017-01-31",
                      limit = 100,
                      useLabels = TRUE,
                      seenUnansweredRecode = "UNANS",
                      verbose = TRUE)

# }
